article.headline: Berkeley Lights stock more than doubles at its open, valuing the company at $3.1 billion
article.body: Shares of Berkeley Lights Inc. BLI, -0.74% took flight Friday, as the cell biology company went public at a price that was more than double what the upsized initial public offering was priced. The stock's first trade was at $51.05 at 1:03 p.m. Eastern for 976,777 shares, or 132.0% above the $22 IPO price, which was above the expected range. With about 60.94 million shares outstanding after the IPO, the opening price values the company at about $3.11 billion. Berkeley Lights went public at a good time for IPOs, as the Renaissance IPO ETF IPO, +1.98% has run up 45.5% over the past three months, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 12.1%.
